snippet: City Ballet opened its spring season on Tuesday with three works by George Balanchine, “Serenade,” “Kammermusik No. 2” and the “Brahms-Schoenberg Quartet.”
abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews first performance of New York City Ballet's spring season at the David H Koch Theater.
lead_paragraph: City Ballet opened its spring season on Tuesday with three works by George Balanchine, “Serenade,” “Kammermusik No. 2” and the “Brahms-Schoenberg Quartet.”

headline.seo: City Ballet Opens Season at David H. Koch Theater
headline.main: Balanchine’s Gift for Joining What Nature Has Sundered
headline.print_headline: Balanchine’s Gift for Joining What Nature Has Sundered
